name: RetrieveAudienceContact
description: Retrieve a specific omni-channel contact in an audience.

parameters.name: audience_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the audience to retrieve the contact from.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the audience.

parameters.name: unique_contact_identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the contact, either a Mailchimp contact ID or a channel hash. Format: email:[md5_hash] for emails or sms:[sha256_hash] for phone numbers.

value_schema.description: A unique identifier for the contact, which can be a Mailchimp contact ID or a channel hash. A channel hash must follow the format email:[md5_hash] (where the hash is the MD5 of the lowercased email address) or sms:[sha256_hash] (where the hash is the SHA256 of the E.164-formatted phone number).

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields_list
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude, using dot notation for sub-objects, when retrieving contact details.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: audience_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the audience.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the audience.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the contact, which can be a Mailchimp contact ID or a channel hash. A channel hash must follow the format email:[md5_hash] (where the hash is the MD5 of the lowercased email address) or sms:[sha256_hash] (where the hash is the SHA256 of the E.164-formatted phone number).

value_schema.description: A unique identifier for the contact, which can be a Mailchimp contact ID or a channel hash. A channel hash must follow the format email:[md5_hash] (where the hash is the MD5 of the lowercased email address) or sms:[sha256_hash] (where the hash is the SHA256 of the E.164-formatted phone number).

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
